arts.sum: How we rated the players. The post QPR v Stoke player ratings appeared first on West London Sport.

arts.ttl: QPR boss makes huge admission after Stoke City left frustrated
arts.sum: The Rangers boss said: “The club knows very well, since the summer, that there are areas I think we need to improve. “I’m not sure that I’ve ever seen a team bottom of the table, 11 or 12 games without a win, and the manager goes out and everyone is singing and supporting the way the fans did.

arts.ttl: Marti Cifuentes explains why Zan Celar took QPR penalty in Stoke City draw
arts.sum: “Zan is an excellent penalty taker and you can see that in his history in Switzerland, Italy and with the national team. This is based not only on their history as a taker in their careers but as well we quite often practice taking penalties, I would say at least once a week,” Cifuentes explained.

arts.ttl: Marti Cifuentes vows to fight on as QPR boss as winless run stretches to 13 matches
arts.sum: I’m not sure that I’ve ever seen the team at the bottom of the table, 13 games without a win, that the manager goes out and everyone is supporting and singing as they did,” said the Catalan. Marti Cifuentes thanked the QPR supporters for their backing as his side slipped to a 13th game without a win in Saturday’s 1-1 draw with Stoke City.

arts.ttl: Cifuentes appears to have doubts about his future as QPR boss
arts.sum: Rangers reaction. The post Cifuentes appears to have doubts about his future as QPR boss appeared first on West London Sport.

arts.ttl: Narcis Pelach reveals why Gavin Ward ruled out Junho's Stoke City 'winner' at QPR
arts.sum: While many managers can often publicly vent their frustrations with officiating calls which prove to be against their side, Pelach refused to take such a stance, instead intimating that he wishes for his side to become a squad which is excuse free and win the game without leaving any doubt. Stoke City boss Narcis Pelach said that referee Gavin Ward ruled out Junho Bae's late goal at Queens Park Rangers on Saturday because the South Korean supposedly handballed on his route to goal.

arts.ttl: Rock-bottom QPR claim point against Stoke City thanks to Gibson own goal
arts.athr: Taha Hashim at Matrade Loftus Road
arts.sum: A win was what Queens Park Rangers, bottom of the Championship, required. In the end a point against Stoke was something to still embrace, particularly after an agonising first-half miss from the hosts’ struggling centre forward Zan Celar. Signed in the summer from the Swiss side Lugano, Celar stepped up for a penalty in the 27th minute, this both the perfect opportunity to finally score for his new club and equalise after a thunderous Tom Cannon opener just moments earlier. Fifteen previous league appearances had brought zilch, but his own fans waited behind the goal, ready to partake in this moment of exultation. Instead Celar shot wide, the visiting support cackling from the other end at his misfortune. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Stoke City player ratings v QPR as Cannon continues red-hot form
arts.sum: QPR continued to pour forwards at the beginning of the second half, although Nardi kept at bay both Cannon and Junho in the same move, and they were rewarded for their efforts when a corner bounced off the unfortunate Gibson and beat Johansson, who otherwise was in inspired form. Stoke were under the cosh a little early doors and Hoops winger Paul Smyth was invited to try his luck from distance on two separate occasions, although both times the ball was caught by a supporter in the home end behind Viktor Johansson's goal.

arts.ttl: Ben Gibson’s own goal gives QPR a home draw against Stoke
arts.sum: Tom Cannon’s goal had the visitors ahead in west London.

arts.ttl: Own goal helps QPR but they remain bottom
arts.sum: QPR v Stoke. The post Own goal helps QPR but they remain bottom appeared first on West London Sport.
